The surprise shake-up announced Thursday appears to be driven by Eric Schmidt 's desire to assume more of a behind-the-scenes role as much as Page's personal ambition. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt wrote on his Twitter account moments after Google Inc. dropped the bombshell that upstaged its fourth-quarter earnings. statement that some objects including a Heart Scarab and a small Ushabti statue were found. Part of a coffin dating back to the Modern Kingdom 3,000 years ago was also found outside the museum. We found two of the eight missing artefacts outside the museum between a government building that got burnt and the gift shop. We are continuing the search and will find more, Zahi Hawass told Reuters. comes from Silicon Alley Insider:`` This is not a loss for Google,'' notes Jay Yarow.`` Increasingly, it has seemed like Eric Schmidt was just an ambassador'' for the company. Our read of the company is that Sergey Brin and Page have been driving most of the major strategic decisions for a while, says Yarow. So what brought the move about? It's probably`` because Sergey Brin and Larry were frustrated with dealing with him. Note the quote from Eric Schmidt that Google wanted to` speed up decision making.

WASHINGTON, Feb. 7( UPI)-- President Bush U.S. Defense Donald Rumsfeld Donald Rumsfeld is conceding`` it's possible'' too few troops were sent to invade Iraq. In a war, many things cost lives, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC in an interview to be broadcast on`` Nightline'' Monday. President Bush has written that the troop level in Iraq was`` the most important failure in the execution of the war.''
